alert.note: Alert for Fall River; Hermosa Foot Hills; Southern Black Hills; Southern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 3:09AM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory this morning, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch with wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory this afternoon through Wednesday morning, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...The Southern Foot Hills, the Southern Black Hills, the Fall River County Plains and the Hermosa Foot Hills. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon MST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow on the plains could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Fall River; Hermosa Foot Hills; Southern Black Hills; Southern Foot Hills
